partOneFundamental.Title: 1 SAFETY 1.1 Helping Those in Danger
partOneFundamental.Rule: A boat, competitor or support person shall give all possible help to any person or vessel in danger.

partOneFundamental.Title: 1 SAFETY 1.2 Life Saving Equipment and Personal Flotation Devices
partOneFundamental.Rule: A boat shall carry adequate life-saving equipment for all persons on board, including one item ready for immediate use, unless her class rules make some other provision. Each competitor is individually responsible for wearing a personal flotation device adequate for the conditions.

partOneFundamental.Title: 2 FAIR SAILING
partOneFundamental.Rule: A boat and her owner shall compete in compliance with recognized principles of sportsmanship and fair play. A boat may be penalized under this rule only if it is clearly established that these principles have been violated. The penalty shall be a disqualification that is not excludable.

partOneFundamental.Title: 3 DECISION TO RACE
partOneFundamental.Rule: The responsibility for a boat’s decision to participate in a race or to continue racing is hers alone.

partOneFundamental.Title: 4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.1
partOneFundamental.Rule: 4.1 (a) By participating or intending to participate in an event conducted under the rules, each competitor and boat owner agrees to accept the rules.

partOneFundamental.Title: 4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.2
partOneFundamental.Rule: 4.2 Each competitor and boat owner agrees, on behalf of their support persons, that such support persons are bound by the rules.

partOneFundamental.Title: 4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.3
4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.3 Cont.
partOneFundamental.Rule:
(c) with respect to any such determination, not to resort to any court of law or tribunal not provided for in the rules; and
(d) by each competitor and boat owner to ensure that their support persons are aware of the rules.

partOneFundamental.Title: 4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.4
partOneFundamental.Rule: 4.4 The person in charge of each boat shall ensure that all competitors in the crew and the boat’s owner are aware of their responsibilities under this rule.

partOneFundamental.Title: 4 ACCEPTANCE OF THE RULES 4.5
partOneFundamental.Rule: 4.5 This rule may be changed by a prescription of the national authority of the venue.

partOneFundamental.Title:
5 RULES GOVERNING ORGANIZING
AUTHORITIES AND OFFICIALS
partOneFundamental.Rule: The organizing authority, race committee, technical committee, protest committee and other race officials shall be governed by the rules in the conduct and judging of the event.

partOneFundamental.Title: 6 WORLD SAILING REGULATIONS 6.1
partOneFundamental.Rule: 6.1 Each competitor, boat owner and support person shall comply with the World Sailing Regulations that have been designated by World Sailing as having the status of a rule.

partOneFundamental.Title: 6 WORLD SAILING REGULATIONS 6.1 Cont.
partOneFundamental.Rule:
These regulations as of 30 June 2020 are the World Sailing:
(a) Advertising Code
(b) Anti-Doping Code
(c) Betting and Anti-Corruption Code
(d) Disciplinary Code
(e) Eligibility Code
(f) Sailor Categorization Code

partOneFundamental.Title: 6 WORLD SAILING REGULATIONS 6.2
partOneFundamental.Rule: 6.2 Rule 63.1 does not apply unless protests are permitted in the Regulation alleged to have been broken.
